SEARCH
Module org.myjtools.jexten
Package org.myjtools.jexten

Interface ExtensionLoader

public interface ExtensionLoader
This interface exposes a method to be used in order to load an extension. The intended way for this is delegate the operation to a Java Platform ServiceLoader.Provider, but custom implementations may use other mechanisms.

Clients are not required to implement this interface unless there is an external IoC loading mechanism that have to be integrated with the ExtensionManager.

Custom implementations are bound to specific extensions by using the Extension.loadedWith() annotation property.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> Optional<T>
    load(ServiceLoader.Provider<T> provider, Scope scope)
    Loads an extension instance from the given service provider.

  • Method Details

    • load

      <T> Optional<T> load(ServiceLoader.Provider<T> provider, Scope scope)
      Loads an extension instance from the given service provider.

      This method is responsible for creating or retrieving an instance of the extension based on the specified scope. The default implementation simply calls ServiceLoader.Provider.get(), but custom implementations may integrate with external dependency injection frameworks (such as Spring, Guice, or CDI) to obtain properly configured instances.

      Implementations should respect the scope semantics:

      • Scope.SINGLETON - Return the same instance across all invocations
      • Scope.SESSION - Return a cached instance within the current context
      • Scope.TRANSIENT - Create a new instance for each invocation
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the extension to load
      Parameters:
      provider - the service provider that can instantiate the extension class
      scope - the lifecycle scope that determines instance management behavior
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the loaded extension instance, or empty if the extension could not be loaded (e.g., due to missing dependencies)
